trans-unit.source: Azure App Service Environment
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service Environment

trans-unit.source: Learn how App Service work
trans-unit.target: Learn how App Service work

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: An App Service Environment is a [Premium][PremiumTier] service plan option of Azure App Service that provides a fully isolated and dedicated environment for securely running Azure App Service apps at high scale, including [Web Apps][WebApps], [Mobile Apps][MobileApps], and [API Apps][APIApps].
trans-unit.target: An App Service Environment is a [Premium][PremiumTier] service plan option of Azure App Service that provides a fully isolated and dedicated environment for securely running Azure App Service apps at high scale, including [Web Apps][WebApps], [Mobile Apps][MobileApps], and [API Apps][APIApps].

trans-unit.source: App Service Environments are ideal for application workloads requiring:
trans-unit.target: App Service Environments are ideal for application workloads requiring:

trans-unit.source: Very high scale
trans-unit.target: Very high scale

trans-unit.source: Isolation and secure network access
trans-unit.target: Isolation and secure network access

trans-unit.source: Customers can create multiple App Service Environments within a single Azure region, as well as across multiple Azure regions.
trans-unit.target: Customers can create multiple App Service Environments within a single Azure region, as well as across multiple Azure regions.

trans-unit.source: This makes App Service Environments ideal for horizontally scaling state-less application tiers in support of high RPS workloads.
trans-unit.target: This makes App Service Environments ideal for horizontally scaling state-less application tiers in support of high RPS workloads.

trans-unit.source: App Service Environments are isolated to running only a single customer's applications, and are always deployed into a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: App Service Environments are isolated to running only a single customer's applications, and are always deployed into a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Customers have fine-grained control over both inbound and outbound application network traffic using [network security groups][NetworkSecurityGroups].
trans-unit.target: Customers have fine-grained control over both inbound and outbound application network traffic using [network security groups][NetworkSecurityGroups].

trans-unit.source: Applications can also establish high-speed secure connections over virtual networks to on-premises corporate resources.
trans-unit.target: Applications can also establish high-speed secure connections over virtual networks to on-premises corporate resources.

trans-unit.source: Apps frequently need to access corporate resources such as internal databases and web services.
trans-unit.target: Apps frequently need to access corporate resources such as internal databases and web services.

trans-unit.source: Apps running on App Service Environments can access resources reachable via [Site-to-Site][SiteToSite] VPN and [Azure ExpressRoute][ExpressRoute] connections.
trans-unit.target: Apps running on App Service Environments can access resources reachable via [Site-to-Site][SiteToSite] VPN and [Azure ExpressRoute][ExpressRoute] connections.

trans-unit.target: What is an App Service Environment?
